channel.title: Portforwarding!
channel.description: This is fucking bullshit....I have posted topics like this for days now, and NO ONE Has fucking answered. Is this fucking community THAT stupid to where they don't even know how to portforward? OMG! And don't tell me to "GOOGLE" it, because Google is NOT The answer to everything, I CANT Portforward, HELP!!!!

item.title: Portforwarding!
item.dc:creator: @djvawter djvawter
item.description:
@djvawter wrote:

[quote=“adecker, post:3, topic:321250”]dude. maybe its cause if you use google right…you find the answer!!! omg! o_o

please dont double post.[/quote]
dude, what a smart ass. there is no ‘right’ way to do it fuck tard. you punch in the damn letters and click the “search” button…results come…so instead of giving this guy bogus answers, how about helping him? if you are not answering his question, fuck you and dont bother posting. fag!
now, to answer you question to my knowedge, the only other way i know of is using utorrent. you need a no-ip and thats pretty much all. no-ip is simple to get. if you google no-ip, the website to get one should be first on the list. just register there. its pretty simple. thats all i know cuz i had the same question as you but i have yet to portforward…

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding!
item.dc:creator: @teh_war_of_noobs teh war of noobs
item.description:
@teh_war_of_noobs wrote:

When you have no router and no modem working as router and are not natted, you should only use UPnP with random port. Allow utorrent in windows firewall and you’re fine (as written in http://www.utorrent.com/setup_guide.php).
Use this guide from beginning until it works!

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding!
item.dc:creator: @Lord_of_fallen_Angel Lord of fallen Angels
item.description:
@Lord_of_fallen_Angel wrote:

adecker:

Lord. go into cmd. type ipconfig. take the DEFAULT GATEWAY and type it in a web browser. sign in. tell me if it works and what u see.

I already Tried Portforwarding through that method, but Port 43594 is still not open.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Lord_of_fallen_Angel wrote:

teh war of noobs:

ummm just use hamachi, that way you don’t have to portforward, and you can put it online from there. if i find anything than i’ll get back to u asap

Thanks…If you do find anything, just PM Me.

item.title: Portforwarding!
item.dc:creator: @Lord_of_fallen_Angel Lord of fallen Angels
item.description:
@Lord_of_fallen_Angel wrote:

[quote=“adecker, post:3, topic:321250”]dude. maybe its cause if you use google right…you find the answer!!! omg! o_o

please dont double post.[/quote]

I googled the following, and found NOTHING:

Portforwarding
RuneScape Portforwarding
RuneScape Private Server Portforwarding
Opening Port 43594
Port 43594
Portforwarding 43594

And found nothing…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 22, 2009, 03:14:04 pm[/size][hr][quote=“deathschaos9, post:2, topic:321250”]If you have a router, you can port forward… Whats your router type?[/quote]

I don’t have a router, I have a Modem.
